meanings.definition: In a brave or heroic manner.
meanings.sent1: He charged gallantly into battle, showing great bravery.
meanings.sent2: The knight gallantly rescued the princess from the dragon.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gallantly defended its acorn stash from the sneaky chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter gallantly faced the raging flames to save the family trapped inside.
meanings.sent5: The young girl gallantly stood up to the bully, refusing to back down.

meanings.definition: In a courteous or chivalrous manner.
meanings.sent1: He held the door open gallantly for the elderly lady entering the store.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman gallantly offered his seat to the tired mother on the bus.
meanings.sent3: The cat gallantly presented its toy mouse as a gift to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The waiter gallantly served the customers with a smile, ensuring their satisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The student gallantly helped his classmate with their homework, showing kindness.
